description: A shattered fragment of alien resin.  It looks a bit like a large piece of sea glass, frosted and gritty with the edges rounded off.  It is somewhat warm to the touch.

A large pod the size of a beer keg, filled with gooey alien resin.  Squeezing it firmly causes resin to squirt from the broken stalk at the end, hardening within a few seconds of being exposed to the air.

A branching trunk of leaves from a massive fern, about two feet long and a couple of feet across in diameter when including the leaves.  Maybe one day you'll think of something to make with a giant fern.
A collection of hand-soldered wires leading to plugs and what looks like a micro controller.  The plugs look like they could be attached to you, assuming you have a Standard Neurobionic Interface.
A collection of mismatched pipes, wires, and a central device that looks like a micro controller.  It almost looks like it could be used for some form of central cooling.
Thin metallic strips with an ochre sheen, interlaid together into a flexible mesh.  You can't tell whether it's a circuit, a heat dissipation component, or a mechanical actuator.
A slightly curved plate of white metal.  It readily collects low amounts of static charge.
A collection of tiny metal strips, spheres, and other geometric primitives taken from a disassembled alien machine.
A very heavy sphere, presumably made almost entirely of gold.  The complex pattern etched across its surface implies that it might serve some exotic function.
A robotic assembly of unknown function.  Entirely made from tight-fitting metal plates, it somewhat resembles the interior of a mechanical clock.
A carved sphere embedded with small black glass screens.  It's probably a sensor of some kind.
